Jokowi Kesal Soal Cangkul Masih Impor, Ini Kata Apindo
07 Nov 2019, 01:03 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi menyayangkan banyak barang yang diimpor dari luar negeri padahal industri dalam negeri bisa memproduksinya. Ia mencontohkan besarnya angka volume impor untuk pengadaan pacul dan cangkul.
"Ini puluhan ribu, ratusan ribu cangkul yang dibutuhkan masih impor. Apakah negara kita yang sebesar ini industrinya, yang sudah berkembang benar, pacul dan cangkul harus impor?" kata Jokowi dalam acara Rakornas Pengadaan Barang/Jasa Pemerintah 2019 di JCC, Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Menanggapi hal ini, Asosiasi Pengusaha Indonesia mengharapkan dukungan produk lokal yang dilontarkan Presiden Jokowi juga diwujudkan dalam bentuk regulasi yang ramah dunia usaha.
Ketua Umum Apindo Hariyadi Sukamdani menuturkan, upaya presiden meminta optimalisasi industri dalam negeri harus didukung. Selain menggerakkan ekonomi di dalam negeri juga akan membuka peluang kerja.
"Produk yang bisa dihasilkan sendiri, ya kita dorong dilakukan [produksinya di] dalam negeri," kata Hariyadi di Kantor Wakil Presiden Jakarta, Rabu.
Menurut Hariyadi, sangat banyak produk-produk industri dalam negeri yang mampu memenuhi kebutuhan belanja pemerintah maupun industri dalam negeri. Namun masalahnya produk lokal belum kompetitif karena terkait regulasi.
Kemarin, Presiden Jokowi meluapkan kekesalanya atas pasokan produk impor yang dipajang pemasok lokal dalam atalog elektronik (e-catalogue). Jokowi menyatakan dirinya mengetahui adanya pemasok lokal yang memasok barang impor.
"Enak banget itu. Hanya ngecap (memberi cap ke lokal ke produk impor) untungnya gede banget, tapi produksi dalam negeri jadi berhenti karena barang kita enggak masuk ke e-catalogue, kalah bersaing," kata Jokowi dengan nada tinggi.
Jokowi menyatakan pemerintah harus memberikan insentif khusus kepada industri kecil yang barang-barangnya masuk e-catalogue. Insentif itu perlu diberikan supaya produk industri kecil bisa masuk e-catalogue.
Di samping itu, Jokowi berharap persyaratan usaha kecil dan menengah (UKM) yang akan masuk ke e-catalogue dipermudah dengan kualitas yang harus dijamin. Jokowi meminta UKM didampingi dan diberikan jasa konsultasi supaya produknya bisa masuk e-catalogue.

Jokowi Upset about Hoe Still Imports, This Is Apindo Said
Nov 7 2019, 01:03 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - President Joko Widodo or Jokowi regretted that many goods were imported from abroad even though the domestic industry could produce them. He cited the large number of import volumes for hoe and hoe procurement.
"This is tens of thousands, hundreds of thousands of hoes needed are still imported. Is our country this big, which has developed right, hoe and hoe must import?" Jokowi said at the 2019 National Procurement Meeting for Government Goods / Services at the JCC, Senayan, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Responding to this, the Indonesian Employers' Association expects the support of local products launched by President Jokowi to be realized in the form of regulations that are friendly to the business world.
Apindo Chairperson Hariyadi Sukamdani said, the president's efforts to demand the optimization of the domestic industry must be supported. Besides moving the economy in the country, it will also open up employment opportunities.
"Products that can be produced by themselves, yes, we encourage [domestic production] to be done," Hariyadi said at the Vice President's Office in Jakarta, Wednesday.
According to Hariyadi, there are many domestic industrial products that are able to meet the needs of government and domestic industry spending. But the problem is that local products are not competitive because they are related to regulations.
Yesterday, President Jokowi expressed his frustration over the supply of imported products displayed by local suppliers in e-catalogs. Jokowi said he was aware of local suppliers supplying imported goods.
"It's really delicious. It only tastes (stamped locally on imported products), fortunately it's really big, but domestic production stops because our goods don't go into e-catalogs, can't compete," Jokowi said in a high voice.
Jokowi said the government must provide special incentives to small industries whose goods are included in e-catalogs. The incentive needs to be given so that small industrial products can be included in the e-catalog.
In addition, Jokowi hopes that the requirements for small and medium enterprises (SMEs) that will enter e-catalogs are facilitated with quality that must be guaranteed. Jokowi asked UKM to be accompanied and provided consulting services so that their products could be included in the e-catalog.
